title: Drawing, "Design for Cornice of Oblong Ceiling", 1770–80
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and grey and black wash, graphite
inscribed:
Signed bottom left in pen and brown ink: "J.C. Delafosse."
Red Crayon: 112
Pen and black ink: N59
provenance:
From the Collection of Léon Decloux. In Decloux's collection in 1906. 
Ex-coll. Hippolyte Destailleur (sold, Paris, May 19, 1896 for 400 francs.)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: One quarter of the ceiling is shown. A circular medallion portrait of a woman is obliquely shown over a satyr mask and festoons in the corner. It is topped by a pair of doves, Cupid and Hymen. The sides are to show censers between acanthus spirals and behind festoons.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Cornice of Oblong Ceiling", 1770–80.
1770–80. Pen and black ink, brush and grey and black wash, graphite. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-43.
